page.title: 08A Cottage,Kirkby
page.content: My cottage was made by the Duke of Portland for his farmers. We have three downstairs rooms. Each room was used as a house for farmers with ten or so children. The kitchen used to be a stable. It has a pine dresser. The china tea service in it has a flowery pattern. In the dining room there's a granddaughter clock with a carved pattern on the top. The room is green and dark pink. We have a french window leading to the garden. The front room is beige and green. On the oak mantlepiece stand an elephant and an ashtray with a moulded dog's head. My bedroomm has cottage style curtains. When you have the window open it's like being in a meadow because there's flowers on the wallpaper.
